DER82403-d-08-24-03-SKOL.Narrative: TWO LOCOMOTIVES WERE SET OUT ON #7 TRACK WITH THE HANDBRAKE SET ON THE LOCOMOTIVE HLCX 5113.  WHEN THE AIR HAD BLED-OFF.  THE HAND BRAKE FAILED TO HOLD THE TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND THEY ROLLED DOWN AND STRUCK ANOTHER TRAIN CONSIST THAT WAS BEING SWITCHED ON ANOTHER TRACK.  THE LOCOMOTIVES DIDN'T DERAIL OR CAUSE ANY TRACK DAMAGE.  THE HLCX 5113 LOCOMOTIVE DID RECEIVE SOME DAMAGE.  THE HANDBRAKE HAS A RELEASE AIR VALVE THAT WHEN THE HANDBRAKE IS SET IS SUPOSE TO BLEED OFF THE AIR SO THE HANDBRAKE CAN BE SET TIGHTER.  THE AIR VALVE FAILED TO FUNCTION CORRECTLY AND ALLOWED THE LOCOMOTIVES TO MOVE.

21197-d-08-17-03-TRRA.Narrative:
ALSSTL 2300 START TIME, TRANSFER JOB ENROUTE TO 12TH STREET YARD VIA THE NEW LEAD.  THE CREW WAS ASSIGNED TRACK 11 AT 12TH STREET BUT INTO TRACK 13 (5 CAR LENGTHS) BY MISTAKE.  THEY REQUESTED A REVERSE MOVE WITH WEST BELT DISPATCHER. UPON PULLING INTO TRACK 11, THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  AT THAT TIME ANOTHER CREW RADIOED THE TRAIN WAS ON THE GROUND. 
 
UP1825, ALS2000, ALS2001 LOCOMOTIVES AND A CONSIST OF 112 CARS.  THE DERAILED CARS WERE THE 21ST (MP271033), 22ND (NS486772), 23RD (S00115593), 24TH (CNW350611), 25TH (ACFX73327), AND 26TH (DOWX70088).

CREW WAS TO SET THEFOUR LOADS OUT AND SPOT THE FOUR EMPTIES BACK IN ON THE WALL TRACK.  AFTER COUPLING INTO THE FOUR LOADS, THE CREW BEGAN TO PULL NORTH, AFTER MOVING APPROXIMATELY FOUR CAR LENGTHS, THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED THE LOADED CARS BOUNCING AND STOPPED THE TRAIN. 180819-d-08-16-03-SOO.Narrative: CHANGE OFF HOSTLERS OPERATING LITE WAS IN THE PROCESS OF MOVING TRAIN 293'S LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST OUT OF THE DIESEL SHOP FOR THE PURPOSE OF PLACING THE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST ON NO. 293'S TRAIN. CONSIST INCLUDED SIX LOCOMOTIVES, OF WHICH THE EAST LOCOMOTIVE WAS A DEAD UNIT.  AS THE MOVEMENT PROCEEDED EASTWARD INTO THE YARD THE EAST LOCOMOTIVE MOVED THROUGH A CROSSOVER SWITCH AND STRUCK THE 30TH HEAD CAROF THE HUMBOLDT TRANSFER WHICH WAS PULLING OUT OF C42 TRACK WITH 42 LOADS AND 9 EMPTIES, 5,420 TONSENROUTE BACK TO HUMBOLDT.  THE IMPACT RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT OF THE EAST UNIT CP 5396 OF THE LITE UNITS AND SEVEN CARS ON THE HUMBODT TRANSFER. THE CONDUCTOR OF THE CHANGE OFF CREW EXPLAINED THATHE HAD LINED THE SWITCH OFF THE ENGINE TRACK TOWARD C42 TRACK FOR HEADROOM IN ORDER TO GET THE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST OFF THE ENGINE TRACK AND HEADED WESTWARD TOWARD 293'S TRAIN ON C3.  AFTER LINING THE SWITCHES HE HEARD  THE HUMBOLDT TRANSFER START TO PULL OUT OF C42. CONDUCTOR TOLD HIS ENGINEER TO STOP AND WENT OVER AND LINED A SWITCH FOR THE HUMBOLDT TRANSFER AND WAS ADVISED BY THE GENERAL YARDMASTER TO USE THE 21 POCKET FOR HEADROOM TO MAKE THE MOVE OFF THE ENGINE TRACK TOWARD 293'S TRAIN ON C3TRACK.  CONDCTOR WAS ON THE EAST UNIT CONTROLLING THE MOVEMENT VIA RADIO, AS HE WAS LOOKING AT THE EAST SWITCH OF THE 21 POCKET HE FORGOT ABOUT THE WEST SWITCH, WHICH REMAINED LINED TOWARD C42 TRACK AND THE HUMBOLDT TRANSFER.  AS THE LIGHT ENGINE MOVEMENT PROCEEDED EASTWARD, CONDUCTOR PILOT REALIZED

IC&E CREW FAILED TO FOLLOW GENERAL CODE OF OPERATING RULE 6.23 WHICH REQUIRESTHAT ALL CARS, UNITS, EQUIPMENT AND TRACK BE INSPECTED PRIOR TO MOVING THE TRAIN AFTER AN UNDERSIREDEMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION OCCURS.  IC&E TRAIN INCURRED AN UNDERESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATIONAND PULLED AS SOON AS THEIR AIR RECOVERED IN THE BRAKE PIPE RESULTING IN AN FRA REPORTABLE TRAIN ACCIDENT.  IC&E INCURRED $12,943 IN DAMAGE TO THEIR EQUIPMENT.  IC&E TO ISSUED REQUIRED HUMAN FACTOR FORMS TO RESPONSIBLE IC&E EMPLOYEES.
